page.title: 10A typical local farm
page.content: { Bowhayes Farm,Culmstock. farmed by Brian and Pat Churchill. This is a 90 acre dairy farm,which is small by today's standards,holding a milk quota of 212000 litres.This means that a herd of about 40 cows(Friesians)are run.The first 20 calves from these cows are reared on the farm either for cow replacement or beef and the remainder are sold at the local market at Tiverton Junction.Large beef animals are sold at Taunton market. A few sheep are kept and the size of the flock will rise because of the milk quota.The farm is not ideal arable land,however, we do grow about 10 acres of winter barley.Breakcrops of stubble turnips and ryecorn are grown as it becomes necessary to reseed the grass fields.
